alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:50PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McCreary and northwestern Whitley Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1249 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Honeybee, or 10 miles north of Whitley City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cumberland Falls S.P. around 100 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bark Camp, Youngs Creek, Deering, Grove, Walden, Clio, Rye, Faber, Barton and Rockholds. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 17 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
